summary: The document serves as a routing and record sheet for the review of chapters from David Phillips' book 'The Night Watch' in accordance with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details the procedure for examining the chapters for classified information, insights gained during Phillips' tenure as a CIA employee, and details not previously disclosed by the CIA. The document also references a publishing deadline, emphasizing the urgency of the review to facilitate negotiations over any necessary deletions. Notably, it includes a remark challenging the official recognition of Camp Peary as a CIA facility.
key_findings: The document is focused on the pre-publication review of 'The Night Watch' by David Phillips for sensitive content.
Several CIA divisions participated in the simultaneous review of the book's chapters.
A notable comment within the document disputes the public acknowledgment of Camp Peary as a CIA installation.
It illustrates the CIA's internal bureaucratic mechanisms for vetting publications authored by its former personnel.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
